pr_title: Allow overriding restricted headers for JDK 12+ HttpClient

timeline.message: Allow overriding restricted headers for JDK 12+ HttpClient

timeline.bodyText: Does the JVM check both environment and system properties when allowing these headers to be used? If not we should use whichever it uses directly as Configuration will lookup against both.
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText: Since most of our proxy and other configurations are checking both, users might want to use the same location (either env var or sys properties) for all their configurations. So, checking both as it makes it easier for the user.
replies.author: srnagar

timeline.bodyText:
There are several ways to have allowlist. Could you update the message here? Also, change whitelist wording.
Do we want to change the log level to WARNING?
timeline.author: sima-zhu

timeline.bodyText: What's the purpose of having Case_Insensitive_Order?
timeline.author: sima-zhu

replies.bodyText: Case insensitive order will allow for set.contains() to ignore case and evaluate if the header is restricted or not. See unit tests.
replies.author: srnagar
